intro: Tigridiopalma, commonly known as the star cactus, is a unique plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant has a short, thick stem with clusters of spiny, paddle-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Tigridiopalma is well adapted to hot, dry climates and requires minimal water once established.
